meanings.definition: Characterized by straight lines or angles.
meanings.sent1: The rectilinear pattern on the floor made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The artist preferred a rectilinear design for his paintings.
meanings.sent3: The rectilinear arrangement of books on the shelf looked surprisingly neat.
meanings.sent4: Her strict, rectilinear approach to problem-solving never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The rectilinear structure of the building stood out among the curving streets.

meanings.definition: Moving in or forming a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The car moved in a rectilinear path down the road.
meanings.sent2: The rectilinear trajectory of the rocket was carefully calculated.
meanings.sent3: The rectilinear dance moves of the robot were oddly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: His rectilinear walk gave the impression of purpose and determination.
meanings.sent5: The rectilinear flight of the bird contrasted with the swirling clouds above.

meanings.sent1: The rectilinear shape of the table fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The blueprint showed a rectilinear layout for the new office space.
meanings.sent3: The rectilinear garden beds made mowing the lawn a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The rectilinear architecture of the building was both modern and sleek.
meanings.sent5: The rectilinear fence enclosed the property with precision.
